item.title: Clarice add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "There are years that ask questions and years that answer." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "Biology gives you a brain. Life turns it into a mind." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Veronique Vienne
item.description: "In America, we believe that our happiness depends on getting breaks, even though being American is already the biggest break we will ever get." -- Veronique Vienne

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Anita Diamant
item.description: "The painful things seemed like knots on a beautiful necklace, necessary for keeping the beads in place." -- Anita Diamant

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "It makes you wonder. All the brilliant things we might have done with our lives if only we suspected we knew how." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "Children aren't coloring books. You don't get to fill them with your favorite colors." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Veronique Vienne
item.description:
"The secret of surviving housework is simply to do it. Pull the plug on the part of your brain that always wants to negotiate everything. You need to change a diaper, rinse a bottle, clean a spill, fluff a pillow? Consider it done. It's a no-brainer. End of conversation. End of story.
Not postponing chores-and not spending any mental energy equivocating, temporizing, or stalling-is actually a lot more restful than worrying about what needs to be done. " -- Veronique Vienne

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Patti Digh
item.description: "Instead of a book, what if we're actually writing (or not writing) in the margins of our lives? What if our lives are books? What is the sign of our presence? Are we pressing into the margins our interpretations and questions? Are we circling offending verbs and drawing furious arrows to the margin where we scrawl "irony," "frustration," "voiceless," "unfair!" Or do we simply turn the pages, passively receiving what's given, furiously disagreeing but remaining silent about it?" -- Patti Digh

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "I attempted briefly to consecrate myself in the public library, believing every crack in my soul could be chinked with a book." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "You see mother, you had no life of your own. They have no idea. One has only a life of one's own." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "In Kilanga, people knew nothing of things they might have had - a Frigidaire? a washer-dryer combination? Really, they'd sooner imagine a tree that could pull up its feet and go bake bread. It didn't occur to them to feel sorry for themselves." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "A mother's body remembers her babies-the folds of soft flesh, the softly furred scalp against her nose. Each child has it's own entreaties to body and soul." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "It lasted just a moment, whatever that is. One held breath? An ant's afternoon? It was brief, I can promise that much, for although it's been many years now since my children ruled my life, a mother recalls the measure of the silences." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Sugar, it's no parade but you'll get down the street one way or another, so you'd just as well throw your shoulders back and pick up the pace." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "She is inhumanly alone. And then, all at once, she isn't." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "A first child is your own best foot forward, and how you do cheer those little feet as they strike out. You examine every turn of flesh for precocity, and crow it to the world. But the last one: the baby who trails her scent like a flag of surrender through your life when there will be no more coming after--oh, that' s love by a different name." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Clarice add a quote by José Saramago
item.description: "Inside us there is something that has no name, that something is what we are." -- José Saramago

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Eric Weiner
item.description: "Money matters but less than we think and not in the way that we think. Family is important. So are friends. Envy is toxic. So is excessive thinking. Beaches are optional. Trust is not. Neither is gratitude." -- Eric Weiner

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Clarice add a quote by William Ernest Henley
item.description: "It matters not how strait the gate, How charged with punishments the scroll, I am the master of my fate: I am the captain of my soul." -- William Ernest Henley

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Veronique Vienne
item.description: "Book your life choices in advance the same way you would book flights, car rentals, hotels, and excursions. Figure out early on in your career whether you intend to be financially independent or marry a rich man, join the ranks of the professional elite or be the stay-at- home type, postpone having children or find part-time employment. Then fasten your seat belt and sit tight as you watch your trajectory veer off course." -- Veronique Vienne

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "When I was a child my mother said to me, 'If you become a soldier, you'll be a general. If you become a monk, you'll be the pope.' Instead I became a painter and wound up as Picasso." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not. " -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness that most frightens us. We ask ourselves, 'Who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, fabulous?' Actually, who are you not to be? You are a child of God. Your playing small does not serve the world. There is nothing enlightened about shrinking so that other people won't feel insecure around you. We are all meant to shine, as children do. We were born to make manifest the glory of God that is within us. It's not just in some of us; it's in everyone. And as we let our own light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same. As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Vincent Willem van Gogh
item.description: "If you hear a voice within you say <i>you cannot paint,</i> then by all means paint and that voice will be silenced." -- Vincent Willem van Gogh

item.title: Clarice add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Clarice add a quote by Neale Donald Walsh
item.description: "The deepest secret is that life is not a process of discovery, but a process of creation. You are not discovering yourself, but creating yourself anew. Seek, therefore, not to find out Who You Are, seek to determine Who You Want to Be." -- Neale Donald Walsh
